title: Pay-to-Win
text:
I used the free trial for the elite membership and, man, do things work in your favor when you’re willing to pay the developers $32 a month. Suddenly, you’re playing against people at or below your level, making shots that you would’ve missed before, and winning *almost every match. You’re out of luck the second that free trial expires, of course. You go back to playing against people with a 100+ level advantage, who are making those highly improbable shots and taking back all of that sweet, sweet elite coin. 
*Of course being an elite member doesn’t mean you’re going to win every match, nor does being a regular player mean you’re going to lose every match. I’m simply making the observation that elite members aren’t playing the same game.

title: Ridiculous!
text: I’ve played pool for over 45 years, and this game literally has players scratching the cue ball 2-3 times per game, almost every game. It’s statistically ridiculous. All six pockets make up between 7-9% of the table surface, yet the cue ball finds the center on a regular basis - including clipping off the corner of one pocket and rolling straight to another. The graphics are nice, but the play is unrealistic and statistically silly. Plus - the slam down menus that try to trick you into making unwanted purchases… I’m deleting the app.
